newsitem.title: USA: Consolidated Natural sets '97 cap spending.
newsitem.headline: Consolidated Natural sets '97 cap spending.

text.p: Consolidated Natural Gas Co said Tuesday it approved a $525.9 million capital budget for 1997.
The company said this compares with its currently expected 1996 capital spending of about $513 million.

It said its exploration and production segment will have a 1997 budget of $225 million that will permit increased conventional drilling on the Outer Continental Shelf of the Gulf of Mexico and inland basins.

The company said about $55 million of 1996's $233 million in projected capital expenditures for exploraion and production have been spent on two deep-water projects in the Gulf of Mexico that are nearly completed.
With less money committed to those deep-water projects in 1997, Consolidated said it will have additional dollars for varied exploration and production projects.
The company produces, transports, distributes and markets natural gas, and offers a variety of energy marketing services throughout North America.
